intro: Helminthotheca echioides var. mollis, commonly known as the softleaf helminthotheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are soft and pubescent, while the flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its drought tolerance and attractive foliage.
